noun.description: Law. An officer who seizes and takes a person, or goods or property, into legal custody.
A person who attaches something, by tacking, hooking on, tying, stitching, sticking, clipping, stapling, etc.
A device for attaching something; a fastener, a tie, etc. Often as the second element of compounds.

origin: Late Middle English; earliest use found in Promptorium Parvulorum. From attach + -er.
